qas.question: What against did Metzinger and Gleizes write Du "Cubsime"?
In what year was  Du "Cubisme" published?
What did Metzinger and Gleizes write Du "Cubsime" in support of?
In what year was Du "Squarism" published?
Where was Kupka's paintings not displayed?

context: It was against this background of <a0_0><b3_0>public anger<b3_0/><a0_0/> that Jean Metzinger and <b4_0>Albert Gleizes<b4_0/> wrote Du "Cubisme" (published by <a1_0><b6_0>Eugène Figuière<b6_0/><a1_0/> in <a2_0><b5_0>1912<b5_0/><a2_0/>, translated to English and Russian in 1913). Among the works exhibited were Le Fauconnier's vast composition Les Montagnards attaqués par des ours (Mountaineers Attacked by Bears) now at Rhode Island School of Design Museum, Joseph Csaky's Deux Femme, Two Women (a sculpture now lost), in addition to the highly abstract paintings by Kupka, Amorpha (<b7_0>The National Gallery, Prague<b7_0/>), and Picabia, La Source, The Spring (Museum of Modern Art, New York).
